item.title: By: Ammon Lauritzen
item.dc:creator: Ammon Lauritzen
item.description:
Thanks for the plug ;)
I've never used AbsoluteTelnet, but I'll check it out.
For windows users, I can recommend either <a href='http://www.putty.org/' rel="nofollow">PuTTY</a> (lightweight, open source, zero install process) or <a href='ftp://ftp.ssh.com/pub/ssh' rel="nofollow">SSH Secure Shell 3.2.9</a> (older free version of their commercial client, good sftp support, way more featureful than putty).

item.title: By: Brian Pence
item.dc:creator: Brian Pence
item.description:
Might want to mention that if you want to access your shiny new server from Windows, you'll need to install an ssh client. No version of windows comes with an SSH client. Heck, Vista doesn't even come with a TELNET client! I'd recommend AbsoluteTelnet for both telnet and ssh. Check my sig below for a link.
Regards,
Brian Pence Celestial Software <a href="http://www.celestialsoftware.net"/ rel="nofollow">http://www.celestialsoftware.net</a> AbsoluteTelnet (for <a href="http://www.celestialsoftware.net"/ rel="nofollow">telnet</a> and <a href="http://www.celestialsoftware.net"/ rel="nofollow">ssh</a>)
